title: ## Reading List: Computational Analysis of Political Texts
This list covers a range of topics within computational analysis of political texts, including sentiment analysis, topic modeling, network analysis, and more
**"Computational Text Analysis for Political Science" by Grimmer & Stewart (2013)**: A foundational article introducing the field and its potential for political science research
**"The Political Machine Learning Toolkit: A Guide for Social Scientists" by Grimmer (2015)**: A practical guide to using machine learning techniques for political text analysis
**"Computational Text Analysis in Political Science: A Review" by Benoit et al
A comprehensive review of the field, covering various methods and applications
**"The Oxford Handbook of Political Text Analysis
A collection of chapters by leading experts on different aspects of political text analysis
**"Sentiment Analysis: A Comprehensive Guide" by Pang & Lee (2008)**: A classic overview of sentiment analysis techniques and applications
**"Measuring Public Opinion from Twitter Data" by O'Connor et al
A study demonstrating the use of Twitter data for sentiment analysis and public opinion measurement
**"The Political Economy of Twitter Sentiment" by Tumasjan et al
An analysis of the relationship between Twitter sentiment and stock market movements
**"Sentiment Analysis of Political Text: A Survey" by Saif et al
A survey of sentiment analysis techniques specifically applied to political text
**Topic Modeling & Discourse Analysis:**
**"Latent Dirichlet Allocation" by Blei et al
A seminal paper introducing the LDA model for topic modeling
**"Topic Models for Political Text Analysis" by Grimmer (2010)**: An application of LDA to political text, demonstrating its ability to identify key themes and narratives
**"Discourse Analysis with Topic Models" by Roberts et al
A framework for using topic models to analyze political discourse and identify key arguments
**"The Political Economy of Discourse: A Computational Approach" by Gentzkow & Shapiro (2011)**: A study using topic models to analyze the relationship between media coverage and political outcomes
**"Social Network Analysis: Methods and Applications" by Wasserman & Faust (1994)**: A classic textbook on network analysis methods
**"The Structure of Social Networks" by Scott (2000)**: A comprehensive overview of social network theory and its applications
**"Network Analysis of Political Communication" by Conover et al
A study using network analysis to understand the spread of political information on social media
**"The Political Economy of Social Media" by Gentzkow & Shapiro (2014)**: An analysis of the role of social media in political communication and its impact on public opinion
**"Automated Content Analysis of Political Texts" by Laver & Benoit (2003)**: A book introducing automated content analysis techniques for political text
**"The Political Machine Learning Toolkit: A Guide for Social Scientists" by Grimmer (2015)**: A practical guide to using machine learning techniques for political text analysis
**"Computational Analysis of Political Discourse: A Review" by Benoit et al
A comprehensive review of the field, covering various methods and applications
**"The Oxford Handbook of Political Text Analysis
A collection of chapters by leading experts on different aspects of political text analysis

**Note:** This list is not exhaustive and there are many other excellent articles and books on computational analysis of political texts. This list provides a starting point for exploring the field and its various applications
